intro: Chrysanthemum sanguineum, commonly known as the blood chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its bright red to orange flowers, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant colors and long blooming period.
